The worst of the biggest Battle Royales on the market. Comparing it to Fortnite, Apex, and Warzone, PUBG dies on the vine. The first issue you'll run into is the optimization. It has mostly stayed the same since the launch of the game. It isn't delightful, although the game looks like stitched-up Unity assets. Thank god this game is free now and not like it used to be. My second point is the gameplay. The recoil feels terrible, and the FP camera looks quite clunky compared to the TP point of view. The movement is bizarre. Sometimes, it feels like you're sliding on the floor, and sometimes, your character can barely move. While the game's unforgiving aspect can be adrenaline-pumping in moments when nothing is happening, the game can feel like a walking simulator. Yes, that aspect also extends to other BR games, but in PUBG, it shows because of the size of the maps.

Along with its unforgiving nature, it creates really unfun situations in which you're often killed before you even have time to react. Along with it comes lots of controversies the game and dev team had through its lifespan, like, for example, releasing an unfinished and broken port **** for consoles when the game itself still needs to be fully finished. 

Apart from that, cheating is still an unfortunately unsolved problem. And it's a big enough problem to ruin your enjoyment of the game.

Overall, PUBG, on a bigger scale, may seem okay, but compared to its competition, it has nothing to offer apart from unforgiving gameplay and semi-realistic weapon systems. If you really want to play a battle royale, you've got a ton of better, free, and more fleshed-out options.

It is nothing short of a gaming masterpiece that delivers an adrenaline-fueled experience, blending intense combat, strategic gameplay, and the thrill of emerging victorious in a battle royale setting.

From the moment you parachute onto the diverse and expansive maps, PUBG immerses you in a world where survival is not just a goal but a relentless pursuit. The realistic graphics and attention to detail create an atmosphere that is both visually stunning and tactically challenging. Every footstep, gunshot, and rustle in the distance adds to the suspense, making each match a heart-pounding adventure.

One of PUBG's standout features is its commitment to realism. The gun mechanics are meticulously designed, requiring players to master recoil control and bullet drop for effective long-range engagements. This attention to detail extends to the environmental factors, including weather changes and dynamic terrain, ensuring that no two matches feel the same.

The game's expansive player base ensures quick matchmaking, and whether you prefer the solo experience, teaming up with a duo, or coordinating with a squad, PUBG offers versatile gameplay options. Teamwork and communication are paramount, creating a social aspect that enhances the overall gaming experience.

PUBG's commitment to staying relevant is evident through regular updates and additions. The developers introduce new maps, weapons, and gameplay enhancements, keeping the community engaged and excited for what's next. The evolving esports scene adds another layer of competitiveness, offering players the chance to showcase their skills on a global stage.

The variety of maps, each with its own unique challenges, adds a strategic element to the game. Whether navigating the dense forests of Erangel or battling it out in the urban sprawl of Sanhok, every location demands adaptability and tactical thinking.

In conclusion, PUBG on Steam is a must-play for anyone seeking a challenging and immersive battle royale experience. Its realistic gameplay, dynamic environments, and vibrant community make it a standout title in the genre. Prepare for the adrenaline rush, the heart-stopping moments, and the sweet taste of victory in PlayerUnknown's Battlegrounds.

Decided to try the game again after not playing for a few years and wow it's unbelievably boring. Even though I've played it before, the game forces me through a tutorial mission as I guess that was a newly added feature at some point. It's unskippable and guides you through shit like WASD (wow so useful).

After completing the useless tutorial mission, I'm allowed to join a match and it ends up being a sedate affair of looting empty buildings and shooting the occasional player so oblivious that I think they were bots. I jacked a car and drove around the map in search of something interesting to do, but quickly ran out of petrol.

At this point there are ~15 players left and I decide to end my participation in this snooze fest by barrelling towards the nearest firefight in a desperate bid to have some fun.

At least the game isn't nearly as buggy or laggy as it used to be, but I do remember it once upon a time actually being fun. Seems that part got lost during all the patches. The consolation prize of some lousy skins and in-game currency for once buying this game with real money is also pretty insulting.

I am old I am too old - but yet, I can still take a Chicken Dinner on this game. Practise. Good team mates help. So, so many in my old stream said, so many here said.....full of cheats. My opinion is yes, there can be cheats. I do not think it is as common as some may think. Yes I have been cheated on, well move on and shrug. If you cheat on a game, the feeling of success you will never feel, the pure greatness of winning without cheating, or even winning despite the cheats that can be there. The gun play is so nice. The design of maps, the pure love that has been put into this title, ensures this is my favourite game STILL after having bought it early. The hours I have streamed this, the practice and will not give attitude, the bad days, the good, the amazing experiences I have had in this glorious game I will never forget. Its better with others, solo is entirely ok. I liked the slower pace of earlier versions, but I understand the slow pace can put off the younger player (focus skills, the now now now element of life) well, I love a slow paced 'shoe leather' element that burnt slowly and then suddenly all hell breaks loose. Well, not quite that now, quicker, blue comes in quicker, smaller maps to keep the pace. Yeah, ok....for me would prefer the slow.....its like watching a good TV series over 10 episodes and enjoying it more because the pace changes, rather than a John WIck all action film. Well, that's all personal and JW not for me, but again I'm older than you possibly Played games since PONG and this is where we find gaming now, immersive, skill based and brilliant. For all those who have moaned, abandoned the game, stating cheat...what I have seen from streams and comments, my opinion is that it is that hard to play and win, that the person moaning has not played the required hours to become good enough. It can take 10000 hrs to perfect any action, but after 3.5K of hours, I'm good enough to expect a win here and there. For me the most go back to game ever. Yeah im 58,, yeah I might not be as fast as I used to be (biological but debatable) and THAT'S why this game is great, you can use tasctics and play smart and for someone with less than razor sharp reactions, its entirely possible to win with tactics. I have won without firing a single shot. Its possible. Each game is like a memory and also a new experience all rolled into one.
Generally entertaining and challenging unless OP players or auto-aim etc reduce the startegic elements of the game.

这个游戏我买了，总共玩了不到两个小时。那时候还是2018年4月份，第1次接触射击游戏根本不会玩。刚开始我一脸懵逼跳伞落地在一个房子顶上，后来在房子里面找到一把霰弹枪。刚出门就碰到一个人在门口，吓我一跳直接一枪放倒然后我一秒钟不到被他队友打成筛子。更过分的是一分钟后我得到了一个永久封禁，我当时直接不懂这是什么骚操作。一个kd为0没有击杀过任何玩家反而被别的玩家杀了四五次你他妈判定我作弊。每当我打开steam我他妈就想不明白为什么会这样。最近我明白了，这游戏在刚发行的时候前三年都是随便封禁其目的是为了赚取更多的钱。这他妈是我最近到韩国去旅游之后，韩国人亲自跟我说的。感情他妈老子含冤五年之久才知道是被诈骗了。我不知道和我同样遭遇的人到底有多少，如果有就在下面评论留言。我想组织一批像我这样被无缘无故封禁的玩家对这游戏公司起诉。游戏可封禁但尊严不能丢，没有作弊就是没有作弊。更何况我们都不是慈善家，没有给诈骗犯送钱的想法。因此我希望看到评论的人都在下面留言，大家一起组织起来对这家公司进行诉讼还我们一个公道。

I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single father to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas in 2021 from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So i decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and world and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

Chicken Shawarma

Ingredients for four people:
Chicken fillet 400 g
Parsley 50 g
Pickled cucumber 6
Potatoes (optional) 2
Pita bread 4 (or as needed)
Olive oil 3 tbsp
Onion 1
Parmesan cheese 100 g
Salt 2 tbsp
Turmeric 1 tsp
Ground black pepper 2 tsp
Garlic powder 2 tsp

Ingredients for tahini sauce:
Thick yogurt 4 tbsp
Mayonnaise 1 tbsp
Tahini 1 tbsp
Fresh lemon juice 3 tbsp
Garlic 1
Salt 1 tsp (or to taste)
Ground black pepper ½ tsp (or to taste)

Wash the chicken fillet, take the chicken skin off and slice them into strips. Add them to a mixing bowl.

Mix up the salt, turmeric, black pepper, and garlic powder. Add them along with the olive oil to the Chicken and massage the seasoning into the chicken fillets.

Cut the onion into slices and add them to the Chicken. Mix everything together.

Cover the Chicken with a plastic film and let it sit in the fridge for at least an hour. Chilling the mixture will marinate the Chicken and infuse it with flavor.

While the Chicken is marinating, prepare the tahini sauce. For this purpose, pour the thick yogurt with mayonnaise, tahini, lemon juice, salt, and black pepper into a suitable bowl.

Finely grate the garlic and add it to the bowl. Then mix until the sauce is uniform. Note that the sauce should be as thick as porridge.

Now put a suitable pan on low heat and coat it with oil. Once the oil is hot enough, add the marinated chicken fillets into the pan and sauté until the fillets change color.

Meanwhile, you can fry the potatoes. Slice the potato lengthwise to your desired thickness.

Put a pan on the heat and add two to three tablespoons of oil. Then fry the potatoes in oil over medium heat until they get golden.

Wash the parsley and drain the excess water. Now transfer them to a tray and chop them finely.

Place the pita bread on your tray. Take the tahini sauce and spread it on the center of the bread.

Pile a layer of the chicken fillets, fried potatoes, chopped pickles, parsley, and a sprinkle of parmesan cheese on the bread and roll it. You can top the ingredient with tahini sauce if you like.

At this stage, preheat the sandwich maker, then roast the shawarmas in the machine. In the absence of a sandwich maker, place an unoiled grill pan on medium heat and put the shawarmas in the pan. Then put a heavy object on them to grill them thoroughly.

Once the shawarmas are roasted, and the bread is crispy, cut them in half and put them in your desired dish. You do not have to eat shawarma with bread if you want to stay away from carbohydrates, and you can serve them with salad or plain.

Enjoy your meal!

This is not the PUBG you fell in love with anymore. 
Almost every major change they've made since release has been a step backward as far core gameplay. Gliders, emergency pickups, bluezone bags, BRDMs. These and other gimmicky additions have completely altered the pacing of the game for the worse and don't need or deserve to remain in the game. 
These and other features and balance passes have really lowered the skill ceiling, but thankfully they removed the gadgets like the blue-chip detector and drone etc. 
Having so much gear everywhere means that having your favorite weapon isn't special at all. 
There's just a lot that's been done that makes the game so much less fun and so much more frustrating all the time.

PUBG, or 'Pan Unknown's Battle Groceries,' as I like to call it, is the ultimate virtual shopping experience gone wild. Imagine this: you're parachuted onto a remote island with nothing but a shopping list. Your mission? To gather groceries while avoiding being turned into a human kebab by fellow shoppers. The supermarket is your battleground, and the aisles are your trenches.

Forget peaceful shopping. Here, it's all about grabbing that last can of beans like it's a gold bar in Fort Knox. And if you're lucky enough to find the frying pan, congratulations, you're now the Iron Chef of combat cookery. It's a game of hide-and-seek, but instead of hiding behind curtains, you're crouching in a bush with a sniper rifle, eyeing the frozen food section.

You'll form alliances only to have them crumble over who gets the last pack of ramen. And just when you think you've got a moment to breathe and admire the picturesque sunset, you remember there's a deadly force field shrinking around you, pushing everyone into the ultimate food fight finale.

In the end, whether you're the last one standing or get taken out by a rogue rolling pin, you'll leave with your heart racing and a newfound appreciation for peaceful grocery shopping. PUBG: where 'checkout' has a whole new meaning.

No subsequent BR games have matched this experience for me. They might be technically more refined and arguably better designed, but PUBG was something else. I think I just prefer the feel and lethality of its gunplay. The game's rough edges AKA eurojank actually enhanced it for me – the clunkiness and all contributed to a more intense and satisfying experience.

Don't actually play it anymore tho, rating it positively for the hundreds of hours of sheer adrenaline-inducing fun it provided back then. The introduction of bots totally killed it for me sadly. Before, knowing that every single interaction you'd have with another individual was 100% a human (and thus, super unpredictable) was the best. PUBG was almost a horror game sometimes lol no other game has ever gotten my heart pumping like that.

I miss it. I'm glad I got to experience its peak.

What I had previously said about this game:

"One of the better Battle Royal games out there as well as one of the first! Can be rather addictive so you have been warned but overall a rather fun experience. I look forward to many more years of enjoying this game!"

Now over six years later I can't understand what went wrong with this game and how far it has fallen. Its now an utterly buggy mess in their attempt to stay relevant and is barely playable with massive hardware updates that were completely unnecessary! And the sheer amount of FOMO from season to season has gotten so much worse that unless I had the Amazon Prime free rewards, I see no reason to continue playing it! 

It was fun for the time being but the sun has officially set on this game. Thanks but I'll stick to playing Fallout 76 from here on out...no...let me rub salt in the wounds...even Fortnite is better than this game at this point! Just don't waste your time on this game.

My previous review was made very early on during early access. 

tldr; Relatively highly recommend, just don't spend money in their purposefully obtuse cash shop.

Pretty much every aspect of the game has been vastly improved and de-sync, which was my biggest gripe at the time, is no longer an issue.

I can now recommend PUBG relatively highly.

Now my biggest gripes are related to the in-game cash shop and loot boxes, and the occasional and obvious cheaters. 

The cash shop and "crafting" is all designed to be as convoluted and confusing as possible. It's very difficult to tell exactly what it is you're buying into at all, and with three separate menus all devoted to their own separate micro-transaction/obfuscation methods, it's easily to spend a lot of money and get nothing of value in return, literally or figuratively. I would not recommend spending any money in any of their schemes and if you're going to buy anything at all, buy the items that are available through Steam marketplace.

Regarding the cheater situation, while they're not entirely common, their frequency is just enough to ruin 2-3 rounds a night. Although, there are regular banwaves that take place which should certainly have some effect, if at least a deterrence if nothing else.

Credit where credit is due.
PUBG pioneered the battle royal genre.
There are some things I'm not a fan of personally but overall PUBG is a great game and among the best FPS PVP in the world objectively for its gunplay, movement, environment, and physics.

TLDR

Pros
PUBG has the best bullet physics of any shooter I've ever played hands down.
The options you have in combat are diverse in a massive and detailed sandbox

Cons
Really, there's only one problem with this game for me: Pacing.
Im not a fan of having to find the equipment i want to use
This mechanic boils down to most of my experience being 99% shopping simulator 1% combat.
Also, the shrinking zone mechanic will often force fights youre not prepared for (by design).
Its a shame that because the ring forces constant movement, the opportunity to utilize the long range combat is rare.
Both of these "cons are typically associated with the Battle Royal style so I can't say this is a PUBG problem exclusively.

However, there's an instant action mode that provides set loadouts for deathmatches if youre not up for the BR scenario

In contrast, Rainbow 6 Siege offers the the best pacing of any FPS I've played and brilliantly bypasses the bullet physics by design of close quarters scenarios.

All in all PUBG is an exceptional game and now its free.
(I bought it -_-)
Absolutely worth a try for anyone who enjoys pvp shooters and long range sniping in particular.

I bought this game on 6 January 2017 when it was in beta testing, paid 30 bucks for it too. 
It was full of bugs, crashes, nonsense movement mechanics, nonsense driving mechanics, but it was a true gaming revolution. It was the first true battle royale multiplayer. 

Almost seven years and more than a thousand hours in, the game is still weird. I play it because I'm so used to it, but it still has bugs, it still crashes sometimes, general game mechanics have been improved but not smoothed at all. After every update a bug is fixed, and a new one is introduced. The latest update gift gave me 2-second-long frame drops (from the usual 120 fps to 30-40) anytime I walk into any building. Lovely. With the previous season they introduced default Tactical Packs in your inventory that made the game much more interesting, engaging and strategic.. new season, no more Tactical Pack. They made gorgeous maps that are no longer available to play, whereas the OG Erangel map is always available. You could choose what map to play in a few years back, now ya can't anymore. It seems like when players enjoy something too much they take it away from them. 

So no, I would not recommend getting this game, it will just drive you mad. Oh and by the way, remember when I told you I paid 30 bucks for it? Yeah well now the game is free.

Great game, very fun to play. People don't like to admit it but it true, especially for it being free now. Best gun play out of any fps game and i mean any, including CS, CS GO and COD or any other fps shooters. Of course, not perfect as this is very big game and maps are huge compared to other shooters, but again for being semi realistic and so big maps and 100 players in lobby, not bad. Plus, don't expect it to run of some shitty laptop or garbage PC like you can run fortnite or csgo or other small games as i previously pointed out it is a big game, with 10 if not 100 times the size of cs maps with many more players so requires better internet and specs to run like you'd run cs go or fortnite. Sigh. Yes there are cheaters in this game. But the PUBG culture is damn sweaty too - many hella good players, whom probably obsess over this game to a possible psychopathic level, if you play this you may understand what I mean. 

It's one of the more realistic games as far as movement and gunplay mechanics. If you are going to get better, you will have to grind through the hours.. yes you will die, alot. As you play, you will figure out what to do and what not to do during engagements. I find those intense encounters with enemies unique to PUBG over other battle royales I have played. 
This game is not for the faint of heart. You're gonna yell and curse at your monitor a few times.. its all in good fun. Throughout the years, many cool updates, items, maps have have been added and it just makes this world all the more bigger and possible.

With my hours put in, I don't see myself physically able to just stop playing this game altogether. I will continue to come back infinitely, possibly until The Rapture happens. Save yourselves.

The game, while now free leading to more cheaters is still quite good in terms of gameplay experience and considering they are actively banning people still I'd say they're doing an okay job. The experience hasn't really changed during the years, something I like since many games nowadays seem to take new directions when playercounts go down. The sniping is still one of the most satisfying in gaming and guns are very balanced with a good variation of going stealthy vs guns in blazing in differing situations.

Vehicles are still a bit bugged but very fun to use and actually a necessity compared to other battle royales since the maps are so big, and stuff like getting hit by a car going 1km/h still deals 90% of your health can be annoying but just makes sure you handle your transportation with care, unless you get run over. As always with these types of games they're much better with friends and while most of the respawn mechanics are borrowed from other games they work great to add more suspense if your team dies early. At the meantime you can bully your opponents through the proximity chat when they're or you're hiding, the voice chat is a quite good feature but it was funnier long time ago when the range was higher and you could talk in the pre-game.

The UI is a bit cluttered when it comes to the main menu combined with the hundreds of sub-menus. While they all have a purpose they could be structured in a different way for a way better experience. But while cluttered the UI does allow for lots of customization for mechanics in-game and for your character in which all parts of your body can be customized independently which I see as better than having full skins where fun combos can't be achieved. This however comes with cost, literally as there now seems to be a battlepass, store and lootcrates but since they aren't that intrusive and you gain stuff regularly no matter what it's not something I hold against the game.

Not unique but balanced and feel good to play once you figure it out and especially fun with mates.

PUBG, the only place where I can parachute onto an island, loot for 20 minutes, get my hands on the best gear, and then be killed by someone named 'xXChickenDinner69Xx' hiding in a bathroom. It's like a high-stakes game of hide-and-seek, where the hiding spots have level 3 helmets and the seekers have a frying pan. If only finding dinner in real life was as intense as avoiding the shrinking playzone. 10/10 for making me question my life choices.

[h1]WAT IS WRONG WITH PUBG?[/h1]


[b]_INTRO[/b]
The game concept is fun. As you can see from my hours played, I do enjoy the core game experience of a battle royale with semi-realistic mechanics. However, the developer is working very hard on ruining the experience by creating 3 classes of customers: the ALMIGHTY STREAMER, who [i]allegedly[/i] can get players banned by his word alone. The FOOL, who pays real money to unlock crates to get clothing items. And finally, the PLEB PLAYER, who is at the butt of the joke.

Before we get into the 3 classes of customers, what is this about? Well, the developer made 3 relevant statements:
[olist]
[*]There will be no microtransactions in EA.
[*]There will be microtransactions for cosmetics only (no guns, no armor, no camo clothes) after EA.
[*]There will [i]probably[/i] be no more free crates after EA.
[/olist]

[b]No. 1[/b] turned out to be a lie as there [strike]are[/strike] were microtransactions in EA with the Gamescom crate and all the clothes are on the Steam marketplace now.

[b]No. 2[/b] is nonsense to me as there are clearly clothing items that are better at camo than others. Visibility is [i]not[/i] just cosmetic in a game like pubg. See video above.

[b]No. 3[/b] means that you won't be able to collect a camo-esque outfit after EA for free. You will be forced to pay money for it. You could also find a camo-esque piece of clothing in a match, but it's pretty obvious that someone who starts with a full camo outfit will be at an advantage over someone who has to be lucky and find all the parts in a match. [i]Additional info: you don't keep the clothes you find in a match. Only clothes from lottery crates are yours to keep.[/i]


[b]_THE CLASS SYSTEM[/b]
Now let's look at the ALMIGHTY STREAMER:
[list]
[*]Streamers get custom servers with their own game modes and settings.
[*]The almighty streamer can claim his death was due to "stream sniping" and [i]allegedly[/i] get his killer banned. He simply has to get salty after dying and the devs [i]allegedly[/i] ban the pleb players.
[*]Since the devs included the car horn, it's even better. Players are getting banned, because streamers claim they get harrassed by "stream honking". So you use the horn of a car and a streamer feels annoyed, you [i]allegedly[/i] might get banned.
[/list]

Let's look at the FOOL:
[list]
[*]The fool pays for clothes and thinks: it's only cosmetic, it doesn't give an advantage. He thinks that only the ghillie suit gives an advantage. This not true. There is already camo clothing in the game that gives an advantage. The clothing items in Pubg are NOT the same as weapon skins in CSGO.
[*]This crate crap attracts bots to farm ingame currency and gambling sites. I don't like fraudulent shenanigans.
[/list]

Let's look at the PLEB PLAYER:
[list]
[*]Having fun is ok, but if you want first class support you better be a popular streamer.
[*]Having fun is ok, but if you want an advantage, you probably will have to pay for "purely cosmetic" items that camouflage you.
[/list]


[b]_CONCLUSION[/b]
You will die or find yourself at a disadvantage caused by a bug, bad performance or lag at least once per play session - but if you play this as a lighthearted romp, the derpy state of the game might actually add to the fun. How the dev can perceive his game as "e-sports ready" in this state is a mystery though. Same goes for the microtransactions and streamer drama.

That's why I'd recommend the buggy broken game from a few weeks ago before they added paid crates, but cannot recommend the buggy game that wants to be an e-sport with a p2w lottery crate system.

The game needs work. It's a fun enough, grounded game that needs changes. 

Main gripe I'm writing about is matchmaking. Not times or high ping or that, but when I queue for squads, I'd like to actually play with other people. Out of the last 5 matches I've played casually queued for squads 4 have been solo, which simply isn't fun. I'd like to see an option where IF SOLO > PLACE IN NEW LOBBY, because it's not fun going up against a team of 3 or 4 alone. Even 2 people makes a massive amount of difference.

Now since I play casual I get penalized for quitting those scenarios, or even if my game bugs out. If I'm in JUST THE LOBBY when I quit to re-queue, and my "social credit score" is good, why am I being penalized? I want to play with a team, I'm alone, it literally impacts nobody else except me. And now instead of being able to play three games in a night, I can only play two. It's literally the only game that consistently finds ways to eat my quarters and this is just kind of shit.

Other than that, it seems to break every third update or so. It's definitely running better than it did on release, but the optimization will only get you so far. Throw in the lack of map choice, lackluster cosmetics, and everything else that slowly adds up, you get frustrated with it. It's the least stable game in my library, recently (11/28/2023) causing a memory leak when played

Honestly I'd probably play more, and the recent ping system is a bright spot. But the problematic matchmaking and lack of map selection keeps this game frustrating in spite of everything it has going for it.

I played when it was still in development, and during initial release and a few seasons after. Paved the way for other games of the era. The intensity of combat reminds me of dayz without the 3 hours of looting, much less to loose because you can just start a new match with new players. 

In 2023, the game seems to be much more polished, user friendly, much less buggy, performance is great, new game modes which are actually fun to play, and its free. If you played in the past, get your friends together and check it out again. Worth it.

2nd Updated preview (NEGATIVE): After so many updates and playing this game, I cannot recommend it. This game is so unbalanced, a SMG is better than a M416. A pistol is now better than a shotgun if used right. Vehicles are outdated and it's better to use the newer vehicles. Maps are great until they started removing buildings and landscapes over time. Messing around with loot patterns that doesn't even make sense to me. This game was supposed to be better in physics and combat! Movement is so clunky that you're better off wearing a straight jacket. Just in one month, I have banned over 15 cheaters. As soon as we think that they're improving with their anti-cheat engine, it doesn't matter because they've already ruined your game and apparently have many accounts to play on.
Only reasons why I play this game is:
1) Friends
2) Loot crates that I sell for a few pennies, every week.

I'm not recommending this game. I'm not recommending someone to buy a $30 dollar game that doesn't work on a gaming pc. The lags, the bugs. I bought this game for 2 people and the 3rd instantly asked me to refund it. The rest complains how bad this game is. No, I will not recommend this game to anybody because I don't want them to be fustrated when they've shot a guy with the exact same gun, but some how the guy turns around and kills you because the hitbox was not registering. I will not recommend this game until somehow you guys stop doing microtransaction, and actually fix the game to the point it is playable. I enjoy this game, but I had to spend over 8 hours fixing it. Putting Reshader on, finding out which settings run better, and manage to squeeze every frame per second I can get-- which is funny, because I shouldn't have that problem on a GTX 970. 
I'm not recommending this game, because I had more enjoyment playing Fortnite and that game is free to play.
However, I will recommend this game someday- if it ever does fix the optimization. If it ever does fix the hitboxes. If it ever does fix the motorcycle problem. If it ever does fix the blurriness of the landscape and gun sights. If it ever does fix the horrible parachuting frozen glitch. If it ever does fix the random car exploding when it clips into a chair. If it ever does fix...
Who am I kidding. Probably why they put it on early access and just managed to put 'twitch items' and 'marketplace clothes' for more popularity- thus getting more money. I don't think they're ever going to fix the game. They're just adding to it, and dissing everyone because twitch users are basically bringing them their paycheck.
Please avoid this game until then, or buy it when it on special. Please.[/code]

Cons:
- sometimes a bit unbalanced matchmaking
- sometimes addictive

This game was my introduction to the battle royale genre back in 2017 and, after having spent almost 550 hundred hours playing it,  I think i can try reviewing it in the most estensive way possible.

Content:
Pubg has essentially 3 game modes: solo, duo and squads(up to 4 players) that can all be playied in first person only or in third person. 
At the moment of writing this, the game is centered around 5/6 "active" maps (there is a sort of rotation system in which some maps are taken out for some time , usually a month or two, slightly changed and tweaked, to then be reput in the game) which are quite different both in location and in gameplay. 
For istance there are smallers maps, like Karakin, which offer only 64 players mode and high pace run and gun gameplay. On the other hand there are the classical big maps like Erengel and Miramar, centered around a more slow style of play with 100 players gamemodes.
With regard to the variety of weapon, altough the game was a bit lackluster in that area in its early days, nowadays, after 5 years of countless updates the game has reached a very respactable level in my opinion, as there are many weapons which caters towards different style of play and it will take a long time for a new player to master them all. 
Moreover the games offers a deathmatch mode, which, i must say, its not very tought out as the maps are simply very small parts of the standard BR maps chosen without any apparent logic behind it. Furthermore deathmatch mode is full of max level players who will destroy even experienced players so i would not suggest it to beginners as im sure they would have a very rough time.

Gunplay: 
being a tps/fps battle royale the gunplay is obviuosly one of the most important aspect of the game. At first, especially if you don't have an fps background, it could be very hard to use many weapons properly and effectively, as most of them have lots of recoil(especially ARs, SMGs and LMGs). One of the key there is to understand the attachment system by trying different loadouts in the training mode to learn how to use every weapon effectively. 
Tip: as a beginner try to avoid weapons like the beryl or most LMGs , for example, since they are very hard to master even for experienced players; stick instead to more "noob friendly" weapons like the M416. SCAR-L and M16.

Looting:
looting is a core aspect of the game (as it is in all BRs), given that in every single game you will need to find weapons, armor, attachments, medic kits, bandages and much more scattered around the map. At first it will be very hard to understand how to loot faster and not standing in the middle of a street looting a dead body just to get kill from a sniper hundreds of metres away from you. Onother important thing when looting is, of course items prioritization and inventory management which are key to succed in this game (there are some good guides on youtube about it). All in all i would say the best way to learn how to loot fast and effectively is just to play the game as in my case required some hours just to get the gist of it XD.

Bots:
This is quite a controversial topic as bots were not in the game at launch but were introduced a couple of years down the line. The main motive behind it i think was in part to help newer players by essentially giving them free kills and loot, but also to fill servers (most importantly in areas with very few active players). At first it seems quite minor change but nowadays at least 30% of players in duo and squads matches are bots (at least in my matches anyway XD) and sometimes it really feels like it's all bot. Moreover the bot AI is quite annoying actually as they often stand in open areas shooting each other and other players for minutes  producing lots of noise; the majority are killed by the blue zone; most of the time they stand around some form of cover (like a tree or a rock) moving like mad left and right around it. All this makes them very distracting and annoying and i would strongly suggest to either entirely remove them or toning down their use.

Framerate/Optimization:
Altough in its first years the game was in a very rough state (it is ,after all, a very heavy game) as its fps were very inconsistent and the game was poorly optimized, in its current state it offers a very smooth experienced and can also be playied on medium to low level systems fairly easily. For istance i play with 1060 6gb, i5 7600k, 8gb of ram and to this day the game runs quite smoothly above 100 fps on medium to high settings.

Conclusion:
Pubg is still in 2022 a very good battle royale game and i think for the BR/fps players is a must have also for its contribution to the genre being a true pioneer. Also now its free so you don't have any excuses XD. Finally i would suggest to try it with friends as in my opinion is the best way to have fun while cooperating to get that juicy chicken dinner XD.

I hope this review is helpful, much love, bye ;).

I think this is the best Battle Royale game that is on the market right now.
+ Solid Battle Royale gameplay. You get dropped out of the plane and you need to loot places, get into fights and take down the enemy 
+ Very High Replayability
+ You can have great fun with your friends
+ You can switch between First Person and Third Person mode in the lobby
+ When you play the game you can earn points and with these points you can buy stuff in the game and sell them on the community market (Outfits, Crates)
+ You can drive cars in the game (Jeep, Buggy, Bike, and the Dacia)
+ You can make your own outfit with cosmetics or choose to get a cool outfit with the squad
+ The new map Sanhok with increased loot is awesome
+ Decent graphics

- Lots of bugs (Random crashes, Vehicle getting stuck in a fence and you explode, Getting stuck in objects, Teleporting under the map and get the game win)
- Lots of cheaters (Flying cars, Aimbotters, speed hackers)
- Only 3 maps to play (Erangel, Miramar and Sanhok)
- Poor optimization
- When aiming at someone close standing behind objects can cause that the bullets connect in the wall, so you don't actually shoot the enemy but they can just kill you without you hitting them
- Bad sound

I would recommend this game :D

Pubg.

It's a Battle Royale with up to 100 players that can be
played in solo's, duo's, or squad matches.

Different sized maps with more to come allowing different styles of
gameplay including weather changes in current matches and having sunsets,
and sunrises. Currently they have 1x1, 2x2, 3x3, 4x4, 6x6, and 8x8km maps
with of course skins that you can obtain through playing or using real money
to purchase "G-Coin".

Sometimes you'll feel like you ripped a person 
apart but notice that half the shots didn't register.

Can feel like a running simulator at times, so try to grab a vehicle
and a mate with a microphone to communicate with, otherwise it can become
stale quickly as some matches can last 30 minutes.

Other than that, at 1900 hours, I just switched from playing third person 
for 1700 hours to first person and it's like a whole other game. Still fun at times,
but can be infuriating too.

Playerunknown’s Battlegrounds
Date Written: 12/06/2020

[h1]Choose Your Own Adventure Battle Royale[/h1]

I’ve been playing this since almost the very beginning. It has evolved so much over the last few years. There have been lots of ups and downs. I’ve met tons of people through this game and even have built a small community.

[list]
[*]Arguably the best shooting mechanics around.
[*]Went from basic movement to now having vaulting and ledge grabbing. These don’t necessarily always work the way you intend.
[*]The game can run badly so it is common to reduce the fancy looks for smoother game play.
[*]Audio sounds great but has had serious bugs.
[*]Best battle royale but the ups and downs have scared many away, rightfully so.
[*]There are hackers, cheaters, etc.
[*]Most maps out of any of the battle royales.
[*]There is little to no story for this game. They are trying to add some story elements in. However, the choose your own adventure style of the game has the ability to create memorable moments nearly every game (assuming you don’t jump school every game.)
[*]Queue times can be an issue depending on region.
[/list]

This game is hard for me to review because I’ve seen so much change over the years. Some that watch it may say it looks janky but with so much time played it doesn’t feel that way to me. When this game works it's the best game around.

11/23/2023 Update

PUBG has grown significantly since I originally wrote this review. I stand by the style of battle royale that it is. There are still adding maps, added clans, updated comeback mechanics, added guns, and just generally trying new things out. It still tries to stick to the old formula while trying to bring in some of the expected gameplay mechanics that you see in other BR games. The learning curve is brutal, the devs have plenty to work on, and things to figure out. I still highly recommend this as the best BR around. It's free now a days, give it a try.


For a sneak peak watch The One B’s PUBG Clips on this YouTube Playlist: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL1z20k89bhux-K5OopNSlGyjMnJT9oXmi

Or

Watch The One B’s Last 5: A Chicken Dinner Series on this YouTube Playlist: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL1z20k89bhuz2reH2FcrNqf9U4c2F07dh

I am a long follower and player of pubg since watching Node and their zombie series. I waited and waited for it to come to console, then finally got a PC of my own. I cannot recommend PUBG anymore, it is aged and is outpaced in terms of battle royale enjoyment for me. It is slow paced, you will go 15 minutes of looting and not seeing anybody then one engagement that you have no idea where you got shot from and your back in the lobby. This isn't just me crying because I'm bad too. The amount of people playing this game that are actually from NA amounts to that less than a population of a farmstead in the middle of nebraska. You will not enjoy your time with this game once you are past your bot lobbies. Recoil will take ages to learn. Audio is so loud you can tell the room and building some dude is in from the other side of the city. You might have some good games, but overall the skill gap and sweats will stop you from enjoying over 10 hours these days.

PUBG is possibly my new all time favorite game. I originally came from the Battle Royale Mod that PlayerUnknown made for Arma 3, and as soon as I saw that he had began developing his own standalone game I knew I needed to get it. I waited a while to write this review because I wanted to soak alot before I expressed my opinion. I'm going to start by saying that PUBG without a doubt has some problems. Some of these include the occasional server lag and the chinese takeover of the NA servers. This I feel will be getting fixed in the long run seeing that the devs are very enthusiastic about their game. Now some people say its stupid that you can get banned from stream sniping/ team killing, this is their way of trying to fix trolls and people that ruin the experience. There are ways they can change that and better ways to prevent the cheaters but the game hasnt been out for a year yet. The devs are trying and will find a way to fix these problems. The game also has a great deal of good things. This includes but is not limited to monthly updates and weekly patches. The monthly updates always add new items or aspects into the game, some are small and some are big. They are also working on more maps to try to prevent the game getting boring and repetitive. Another pro is that the game is realistic but not too realistic, there are realistic aspects but they arent too hardcore. Some examples could be bullet ballistics, muzzle flashes, bullet types, and grenades, some things that prevent it from being too hardcore is there is no bleeding unlike H1Z1's bleeding mechanic. This game is a very fun and chill game to play with your friends or by yourself, I highly recommend it.

After years of playing, I can say PUBG still sucks...
Matchmaking is poor. When I'm trying to play in squads with a random team sometimes I can't get even 1 teammate so I need to leave and start again to have another 3 teammates for the game in squads. Also sometimes there are toxic players, who are trying to kill me or other teammates without any reason. Plus a lot of China players buying accounts even after bans and keep playing on EU servers and destroying are any fun in this game...All of these problems without a solution by devs all over years...
I can say, they fix freezes and bugs, but not matchmaking and there is no enjoyable game as it is can be!
You can ask, why are you playing this game then? I will answer you because I like the physics and the movements in this game and the whole concept, it's better than Tarkov or DayZ for me, so I'm here only because of this and the chance to get in the squads with good teammates, then this game is enjoyable for me. You can try Dayz, Tarkov, or maybe something less popular! Dayz is good for newbies because of community PVE servers, try them!

The Godfather of the the "Battle Royale", a love/hate relationship and despite the flaws it's still by far one of the best and most fun multiplayer games, nothing as exciting as your 1st chicken dinner, gets less exciting after you spend a huge amount of time playing it and winning more.

This is the highest amount of fun i had for 30$ i spent on anything in life, game is better played in Duo/Squad because some solo tend to be lonely and a bit boring when you don't have any action for 20 minutes.

For all the new players, this isn't an easy game, if you think you can win and master this game after 20 hours please don't bother buying it and start nagging in the reviews/forums/reddit, you need a huge amount of playtime and patience to become decent and learn the mechanics

Devs need to focus more on what is important to move this game to another level, especially if they want it to become an eSport game, which i don't see happening at the same scale they had in mind and not just because of the bugs in the game but the actual luck involved in each match (random weapons, armor, circle).

I am a 45 -year -old father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single father raising my son, who is now 14 years old. My son won this game from his uncle, so we installed him on his computer and he started playing. Until the end of the week he had 24 hours in this game. This was horrible for me, because it was hard to find ways to spend time with my son, because he is always with friends or just watching Youtube. So I decided to do a Steam account and get this game to see if I could play beside him. I bought the game, chose my skin and world and started playing, but I was stuck in what you should do. I asked my son for help and he organized a game for me to participate. I loved it, because it was the best time I spent with my son since my wife died. Since then, this game has approached me and my son again and now we spend time together away from home as well. This game reminded me that there is fun in everything, and I brought many happy memories to me and my son.

2017-11-26:
The (IMHO) best BR game out there right now, by the daddy of the genre. Fear, frustration, challenge, and elation will all be yours as you roam the landscape of Erangel alone or with (hopefully) friends to battle for supremacy.

Sure the game has flaws, but it's still in early access, and it's still being actively worked on. Time will tell if this game wrinkles out it's issues and reaches the full potential it certainly has.

2018-11-26: Game is still fun, still buggy. Has improved in many ways over the last year, but is still marred by the (apparent) incompetence of it's developers in fixing long-time bugs and optimizing the game and servers.

2019-11-27: One year later... many improvements in QOL and gameplay, and arguably a few regressions. Servers are better on the whole, but still flaky sometimes. The loss of map selection in certain regions (NA!) is frustrating. Skins are still overpriced. Core gameplay is still great, devs are still pretty crappy. Less blatant hackers, at least in NA.

2021-11-24: It's still pretty fun but player count has tanked. YMMV.

2023-11-21: I haven't played much in the last couple years. They've added lots of equipment to the game, and I'm not sure how I feel about it...

It started with a Arma 2 mod. After that it got ported to Arma 3.

Now he got the "control" about his game. He can decide everything. That's how it started!

It offers some huge (and some small) maps, many weapons and vehicles and so much fun.

Player Unknown's Battlegrounds.   What can I say?  The game is amazing. A quick disclaimer....the game is in early release so you should not expect a complete game. The premise of the game is you start in a airplane flying over an open world sandbox with the goal of being the last person standing out of 96-99 people (depending on game mode). You jump out of the plane and have to gather gear, health, and weapons to fight with in the game. As time progresses there is a zone that grows smaller and smaller forcing people closer together. If you're caught outside of the zone it will kill you. You can play in squads (4 player teams), Duo's (2 player teams), or Solo's with it being you verses 99 enemy's. If you manage to survive  to the end you get the win, which the game calls a chicken dinner. This game will give you a massive adrenoline rush and is tremendously fun. I personally have had 3-4 wins where I didn't have to fire a shot with the enemy dying outside the zone. New content is expected to be released shortly and the designers are trying to finish/polish the game to have it fully released by the end of the year. 

Buy this game and try it today!

UPDATE NOV 2023: This is a BR game you can never really quit. I always come back to it. Even on mobile version. Now, if you're wondering about hackers, I'm sure there are some but personally I haven't really run into it. Not at least the blatantly hackers. Though some deaths were questionable, hackers aren't really problematic in BR settings. Maybe in arcade mode such as team death match where the sometimes enemies seems like they know where you are and they seem to shoot a lot more accurately than you do. But then all of that DO get thrown out of window because with enough practice you can control your recoil of the gun and track your enemies via noises. Old Review Dec 2017:

Graphics (2017): 5/10
Gameplay: 8/10
Sound: 9/10
Customization: 7/10
Weapon Variety: 6.5/10
Performance (GTX 1080): 85-115 fps @ULTRA 1080p
Fun: 10/10

The game succeeds in creating a tense environment and forces the player to constantly keep on moving. Its an excellent concept with and even better execution. Some things could be better such as the graphics. They look pretty dated for a game in 2017 but graphics are not everything and where the game is good, its really good. The gameplay is solid but the jumping mechanics could be worked on a bit more. The sound is really detailed and even the smallest of mistake can give away your location to those in your vicinity. Every experience is different from the previous; sometimes you may get lucky and find a gold mine of weapons, armors and ammo but other times you will fail to find even a frying pan. Speaking of frying pans, the attention to detail is spot on. If not equiped, the frying pan will deflect bullets shot at it and protect your back. HOW COOL IS THAT!

Update 1: Only 24 hours left until this game escapes early access. So proud of the devs who are working hard on this game and have made this game the face of PC Gaming! YOU ROCK!

Alright, buckle up guys! 🎮🍗 Let me spin you a tale of epic battles, old-school reunions, and the most unforgettable moments in the battlegrounds – all courtesy of PUBG! 🔥👫

Picture this: I'm cruising through the virtual terrain, and bam! I stumble upon my long-lost school buddies, bringing a touch of nostalgia to the chicken dinner chaos. 🍗🎓 The best part? We're not just surviving, we're thriving in the world of commerce background banter! 💼💬

But hold on, it's not all serious business. Whether I was celebrating a sweet victory or laughing off a defeat, PUBG became my go-to comedy club. I mean, who knew strategizing during spare time could be so hilarious? 😂🗺️

PUBG, you've been my crash course in improv strategy, and I can't thank you enough for the wild ride. 🚗🎢

Sure, some people might've lost control in the heat of the game, but for most of us, PUBG was the ultimate social hub. Connecting with friends, even in the midst of network problems, became an art form. 🎨🌐

So here's to you, PUBG – the game that turned us into warriors, comedians, and reconnectors extraordinaire! 🥂🕹️ Let's celebrate this unforgettable journey with likes and awards – because even in the virtual world, appreciation is the real chicken dinner! 🏆👾 #PUBGMemories #ChickenDinnerChampions"

I love PUBG and have from the my very first match and getting a chicken dinner on said first match. The gun play is absolutely unmatched, the driving is decent and it works at intended. There are many games out there that are more well suited for other people or younger audiences such as Fortnite and Apex but the do not satisfy like pubg does. There is a lot to love with pubg with the randomness and how each match is different than the last. No gunfight will be the same and it is actually challenging to get a win and it feels very well worth it when you do get one. I can play PUBG all day and granted there are many things that i do not like about the game or maybe the developers themselves but its obviously not enough to keep me away form my favorite game.....

........ NOW FOR THE BAD......

Pubg used to cost money.... its now free to play and that was very detrimental to the game and the player base. with a free game comes what.... cheaters... new accounts....cheaters...and new accounts. how can you possibly keep someone from cheating in this game if you ban their account and they can simply just make another free account??? there are cheaters and you will encounter them i wouldn't say everyday but you will and it is very frustrating. every game has cheaters and banning them will always be a battle so cant be to hard on the devs for THAT but its still a problem note worthy.
With pubg being a free game what else comes with that? well exploiting people for over priced skins and very low customization options unless they are behind an extensive paywall. you don't get to purchase the skins you want they make you use g-coin you have to purchase with real money to buy crates that have a 1 percent chance to get one of the three rare weapon skins in that season...okay lets say you get the weapon out of a crate.. sure, i have before okay well in order to upgrade your progressive skin you just got it cost blueprints which have a less that one percent chance to get out of a crate and you need polymers from scraping other skins. i have over 2000 hours in pubg and i tell you what i have NEVER got a blueprint out of a crate. not only do you need that you need at least 3 for the first skin upgrade and that's just to chance the scope skin to match the gun.... just ridiculous money grab and its a huge slap in the face to all the loyal pubg players out there who love the game but feel they are treated like crap by the devs and exploited for more money.

Other than stated there isn't much i dislike about pubg, i love the game the mechanics and almost everything about it but the cheaters and money grab is something that will forever hold me back from being 100 percent loyal to pubg and bluehole devs. if you want a game though to casually play with friends or alone and want to be competitive then give PUBG a shot. If i'm not playing Escape from Tarkov which i have 3000 hours in then im playing PUBG.

I have been playing this game for several years now. I love the game. But currently would not recommend it to newer people wanting to play. The Devs for the game say they are listening to player feedback on what the actual players want to have changed, but in all honesty, they don't listen. They listen to 1 region only and to hell with all others, instead of working to build up the player base in all other regions. You either have a lobby filled with bots or you have to wait forever for a lobby to fill. 1 main reason is too many maps in circulation. Most regions do not have map selection. The devs keep adding things to the game, which is all in well, but it is not helping with any of the larger issues. So many of the players games crash constantly. But instead of trying to get to the source of the problem we are being told it's everyone's computers. I truly believe this game could be so great and run for a very long time. But not until things are fixed and the devs really, really, start to listen to all regions of players.

PUBG is one of the best Multi Player team based games I have ever played. It is very realistic in almost every way, like gravity, the way the wind blows and moves the grass, the way water moves on the beach, the way cars move and drive especially when they get tire damage and then of course you have the wide range of weapons with lifelike imagery and sounds and bullet drop. Overall I love playing the custom matches that we host and play with friends, because this allows us to control who plays with or against us and it keeps the rampant cheating population that play this game from spoiling our games. Check out our clan PC18 or on Discord PUBG Customs 18+.

Played this to death across two platforms, and at this point, it is clearly not competitive with others within its genre. This game is SCRAPPY. Lots of really poor bullet collision issues (firing past/through rocks or trees and your bullets being eaten by collision), the movement and weapon handling mechanics are slow and janky, the inventory system remains clunky. When I compare this to what I see of APEX (world class) Warzone (solid) Fortnite (meh, but usability is solid), this one just fails on almost all fronts. I cannot bring myself to recommend PUBG to anyone in 2023.

Title: A Battle Royale Masterpiece

Rating: ★★★★★

Reviewer: Raiyan0628

Tactical Gameplay: PUBG demands a level of tactical awareness rarely seen in gaming. Players must constantly adapt to the ever-shrinking safe zone, forcing engagements that require strategic thinking and quick decision-making.

Team Coordination: Communication and teamwork are paramount. Effective coordination with your squad can be the difference between victory and defeat. This mirrors the critical importance of teamwork in real-world military operations.
Realistic Weaponry: The arsenal in PUBG is meticulously crafted, mirroring real-world firearms. Understanding the ballistics and recoil patterns adds a layer of authenticity to the gameplay.

Pros:
Realism and Immersion: PUBG excels in creating an immersive battlefield experience. The realistic environments, coupled with authentic sound design, make every firefight feel visceral and intense.
Continuous Development: The development team consistently updates the game, introducing new maps, weapons, and gameplay mechanics. This commitment to improvement keeps the experience fresh and engaging.
Diverse Map Selection: From the dense forests of Erangel to the desert expanses of Miramar, each map offers a unique and dynamic battleground, ensuring no two matches feel the same.
Global Player Base: With millions of players worldwide, PUBG offers a vibrant and competitive community. Whether you're a casual gamer or aspiring esports pro, there's a place for you in this expansive player base.
Customization and Cosmetics: The game provides an extensive array of customization options, allowing players to personalize their characters and weapons, adding a touch of individuality to the battlefield.

Cons:

Learning Curve: PUBG has a steep learning curve, especially for newcomers. Mastering the mechanics and map knowledge takes time and patience.
Optimization: While PUBG has made significant strides in optimization, it can still be demanding on hardware. Players with lower-end systems may experience performance issues.

PlayerUnknown's Battlegrounds on Steam stands as a testament to the potential of the battle royale genre. Its emphasis on realism, tactical gameplay, and team coordination creates an experience that resonates with military analysts like myself. With a thriving player base and continuous development, PUBG remains a powerhouse in the gaming world.

OK, so I played this game back in 2018 when it was pretty new and was not free-to-play.  I came from the DayZ mod, where gameplay was slow and careful, weapons and resources were extremely rare, and you could lose everything very quickly by getting too close to a group of zombies or encountering an unfriendly player.

PUBG was a completely different kettle of fish, where some of the elements of DayZ had been distilled into shorter play sessions, where the action was frenetic and somewhat stressful.  Picking your jump point from the plane, the descent to your chosen area and the initial desperate search for weapons and supplies, were all elements that injected something new.  

The weapons were realistic and had various attachments that would enhance them, so you were always on the lookout for something to improve what you already had.  The blue electrical field that kept moving in, decreasing the safe space on the island, was great at forcing players out of places where they were hiding.  I remember the stress of hiding inside a building, hearing someone outside come in and start to search the property, knowing that there was possibly someone inside.

[h1] The Good [/h1]
• [u]Intense Battle Royale Action[/u]: PUBG excels in delivering heart-pounding, high-stakes Battle Royale gameplay, keeping each match thrilling from start to finish.

• [u]Diverse Weapon Arsenal[/u]: The game boasts an extensive array of weapons, adding depth to strategic decision-making with each weapon having its own unique feel.

• [u]Large, Immersive Maps[/u]: The expansive maps provide diverse environments, ensuring that no two matches feel the same and contributing to an overall immersive experience.

• [u]Dynamic Weather and Day-Night Cycle[/u]: The introduction of dynamic weather conditions and a day-night cycle adds complexity to gameplay, requiring adaptation based on visibility and environmental factors.

• [u]Customization Options[/u]: PUBG allows players to personalize their characters with clothing and weapon skins, enhancing individuality and providing a sense of ownership.

• [u]Team Collaboration[/u]: Squad-based gameplay encourages teamwork and coordination, adding a social element that enhances the overall gaming experience.

[hr][/hr]

[h1] The Bad [/h1]
• [u]Optimization Challenges[/u]: PUBG faces criticism for optimization issues, with performance varying across different PC configurations, leading to occasional frame rate drops and stuttering.

• [u]Learning Curve[/u]: Newcomers may find PUBG's learning curve steep, requiring time to understand weapon attachments, optimal looting strategies, and map navigation.

• [u]Occasional Hitbox Inconsistencies[/u]: There are instances where hit registration and hitbox consistency can be questionable, leading to frustrating encounters and impacting the fairness of engagements.

[hr][/hr]

[h1] The Ugly [/h1]
• [u]Cheating and Hacking Concerns[/u]: The prevalence of cheaters and hackers disrupts the integrity of matches, diminishing the satisfaction of legitimate victories.

• [u]Server Instabilities[/u]: PUBG has, at times, struggled with server stability issues, resulting in lag, disconnections, and other online connectivity problems.

• [u]Microtransaction Impact[/u]: While optional, the influence of microtransactions on cosmetic items and skins can sometimes overshadow the core gameplay experience, necessitating a balance between revenue generation and maintaining the integrity of the gaming environment.

[hr][/hr]

[h1]Overall Score: [/h1]
[h3] 8.3/10 [/h3]

I am an avid fan of the game and have always appreciated the attention to detail that has been a hallmark of its design. However, I recently noticed a minor yet noticeable inconsistency in the naming convention of PLAYERUNKNOWN's items which I believe warrants attention.

While going through the inventory, I noticed that the 'S' in PLAYERUNKNOWN'S Trench Coat is capitalized, while the 's' in PLAYERUNKNOWN's Bandana is in lowercase. This inconsistency in capitalization might seem trivial, but it can potentially lead to confusion, especially for new players or when discussing these items in community forums. Moreover, it affects the overall polish of the game, reflecting a lack of attention to detail which is uncharacteristic for a game of this caliber.

Consistency in naming conventions is crucial for maintaining a seamless and professional gaming experience. I hope the developers address this major issue in a future update to ensure that the game's high standards are maintained in every aspect, including the naming of in-game items.

THANK YOU KRAFTON. IF I KNEW THE GAME WOULD BE FREE TO PLAY ON PC + MOBILE I WOULD NEVER EVER EVER EVER SPEND MONEY ON YOU.

BIG F TO YOU.

What makes me thumbs down:
-MOBILE VERSION. If I knew mobile version is coming, I'd rather play Mobile one and not spend any money on this game that has been launched. Not even proud of myself bought this game.
-Two big challenges for me: shooting has bullet drop, that with JUST A BIT of lag, and you'll miss most of the shots. That gives me really a frustrating challenge, that is not related/part of the game (the lag)
-Playing this game is giving me stress instead of fun after tiring day of working. Looting and carefully shooting enemies until the last 10 person, suddenly someone one shotted you from afar or out of nowhere, or after intense battle and you failed. Add that with connection issue/lagging and you're in great mix for adding your own stress level. Of course, I dont really blame the game for this.
-The recoil and bulletdrop are hell. The need to tweak this a lot. 
-Cosmetics charge a damn lot. Fk that.

Why previously I thumbed up:
-Freedom to choose where do you want to start, camp, collect weapon, and choose the way you want to play. Be it stealthy, frontal assault, avoid-combat-type, camping type, moving from one place to other (by foot or car) and so on.
-Realistic experience: if you hear gunshot, you duck/prone and take cover. If you unlucky enough you'll get  hit but not knowing where the duck that shot came from.
-Element of surprise: The element of real world + randomness + alertneess: The game can end (you got killed) any second, predicted or not. So be prepared for anything!
-Immersiveness : THE BULLET CASING that has been shot, landed on the ground and IT GIVES OUT THAT "TING" sound hitting the floor. Awesome 10/10 for small detail!!!
-Smooth Gameplay (character movement is already smooth),  but it can do better like KF2 did.
-ROLEPLAYING! Assume yourself as squad leader/point leader or follow each other and guard their backs.

Cons:
-No tutorial for beginner players. You just gotta grip the game by yourself.
-No language divider: CHINESE SPEAKING PEOPLE in ENGLISH game? Please make like DOTA 2 (languange preferences) so I can choose what language we can talk to each other. I got my team wiped out because we did not coordinate well (they cant speak english). Even in the American Server I still encounter chinese-speaking people who cant speak english. 

The price however is a bit too much for me. I DO NOT recommend this game for the current normal price. I'd rather play the mobile version, most of my friends play on mobile phone instead of expensive PC. 

This game does not require you to grind (ingame money is for cosmetics only) therefore those who have limited time might enjoy this game, as you can jump in and out game freely, like Warframe. 

Conclusion:
DO NOT BUY THIS GAME.

This was my first battle royale game. At the height of my career I once got 1st, 1st, 2nd, 1st place in a row with a team of 3 playing against teams of 4.

That said, the game has definitely lagged behind. About 250 hours into PUBG I tried Apex Legends. I hated Apex at first, it felt so cartoon-like in comparison to PUBG. But, I eventually ended up playing Apex a lot more. Apex is much more refined with regards to smoothness of movement, player inputs, and environment interaction. The graphics are a lot better as well. PUBG always felt sluggish when it came to, say, picking items up.

Today I ran PUBG for the first time in a few years to see how much things had changed. For the most part, nothing has changed, except for a KFC sponsorship. Third person mode seems to be where most players are playing too. PUBG has become Fortnite. The graphics are still sloppy. Even on ultra settings it's like everything is drawn at a lower resolution and with jagged edges.

PUBG was a fun thing to do before Apex came around, but that's about it.

As of 2023 I wouldn't recommend that any of my friends play PUBG.

Oktober 2023 - 250+ hours of gametime:

I have been playing since the release on steam in early access. At first everything except for the gameplay was a nightmare. But it also happened to be the only game in this genre (battle royal) that wasn't arcade (like Minecraft hunger games mode), so it became very popular despite it being shit.

When I last played in December 2020 it was less shit, but still kinda bad. They fixed some bugs, and improved on the visuals and performance, as well implementing new maps and weapons. But the game still crashed so often, server performance was very bad, the game often wouldn't even start and there were still a lot of game breaking bugs. 3D sound was a joke at close range and the amount of hackers was insane.

I never wanted to touch this game again. But it just kept calling. After another 1,5 years I decided to give it yet another go. And to my surprise: There was a good game. It no longer crashes, the visuals and performance are enhanced even more. The sound appears to have been fixed. Everything about this game finally feels solid and fun. The only problem remaining are the hackers. The devs are claiming they are banning 100.000 hackers a week, but seeing the player count, I think these are false numbers. The amount of hackers remains very high, which is to be expected now that the game is free. Despite hackers killing you in like 30-40% of your matches, you can just start a new game quickly and try again.

I can finally recommend this game, though you should keep the high likelihood of hackers in mind.

insane game

PlayerUnknown's Battlegrounds, or PUBG, offers an exhilarating gaming experience where you and your team must fight for survival in a last-man-standing showdown filled with intense gunplay and explosions. The game's standout qualities lie in its smooth gameplay and immersive environment. However, there are a couple of aspects that leave room for improvement.

First and foremost, the game excels in providing a seamless and engaging gameplay experience. The gunplay is sharp and immersive, keeping players hooked for hours on end. PUBG's core mechanics create an intense and enjoyable gaming experience.

Nonetheless, there's one glaring issue that detracts from the game's immersion factor: the vehicle exhaust sounds. In a world set in a post-human era, it's hard to believe that vehicles would sound as pristine as they do. The level of detail and care taken in crafting the abandoned island is impressive, but it raises questions about the supposed isolation. Rust and weather-induced wear on vehicles would affect their sounds. This would have been a welcome, nay necessary addition.

During a personal experiment to test this hypothesis, I was abruptly interrupted by a silenced AWM sniper shot.

Air tire pressure is another factor that seems ripe for exploration. 

Despite these minor drawbacks, the skydiving simulation in the game is top-notch, contributing to an overall impressive rating of 102.56/103.45.

Haven't seen a single cheater since coming back to play (a few months). It's much more common to hear bad players cope by crying "cheater" than to actually come across one. They've also made some good moves by speeding up the zones and allowing you to parachute anywhere. Like most oceanic game servers, players are only on during peak hours(afternoon/early night)

cons- small oce player base is split between too many modes: TPP(solo,duo,squad) FPP(duo,squad), +a large potion of players playing in SEA for ranked. resulting in dead games filled with bots

The below review was posted a LONG time ago. Game crashes often, especially a few seconds post launch. When it is playable it just sucks. Go play something else and don't bother.
-
I played other survival games, such as DayZ and Miscreated. I was more attracted by the realism that those provided in some cases worse, in some cases better. The feeling of a squad working like a machinery was also something that I craved for but couldn't find it in the games mentioned or was taken to really high levels, such as Arma III or Squad that imposed dedication and time or didn't appeal to most of my friends. Sometimes, a game comes and takes people by storm, for whatever reason and I think Playerunknown's Battlegrounds achieves that with a punch in the face of people who do not coordinate well. The focus of the game is not basic survival where you can play endlessly by simulating your lunch, eating canned beans and drinking soda. It will not put you to grow tomatoes or run to the supermarket or gas station to pick up groceries while your room mate redecorates your apartment by moving walls and cutting trees for 3 hours straight. It's not like that isn't fun, but in PUBG you simply do not have the time for it. You need to run, hide, shoot, run, take a breather, drink some energy drink to run faster and take some painkillers for your feet because you still have to run the marathon until you reach the inconveniently placed finish line* or manage to find a beautiful Dacia 1300 to rest your ass in after all that slaps you took from the pan hanging from your backpack. Yes. There are plenty Dacia 1300 and frying pans to save your ass and go around after you get a jump-scare that will even make your cardiologist give you a call as you choke on a shotgun aimed by some dude in his tights sporting a bulletproof helmet while sitting in a bathtub. Did I think this game will be fun? No. Do I think this game is fun? It gives you the freedom to spawn in almost any location, sometime post-2004 in a remote place, untouched since the early 70's. It gives you loot, it gives you friends, it gives you heads to aim at, run over or drown. You can play the long version of the game by running and crawling or you can rush through the map on a motorcycle with your best friend and that other guy you sometimes play with in the sidecar, squeeze in and pray in a squad of 4 in a 4x4 in off road vehicles, ride in style in a Dacia or drive in a race car that looks like it was "born" by a more Eastern European version of Mike Evans. The tools you can use to subdue your enemies range from crowbars and 15x sniper rifles to smoke grenades and flashbangs. Player customization reduces to a few items. Rush through the looks of character you create because the only thing that matters after you slap a motorcycle helmet and a gas mask is whether you want the enemy to shoot you in the breast or dick. So this game is as fun as you make it to be. Of course, it's amazingly hard to overlook the unfinished mechanics, the rather crude graphics, less-than-average sounds or the fact that it throws one hundred people in a single map. Yes, 100 screaming people go in, 1 really sweaty person comes out. And really, that is it!
*Note: The finish line is actually a circle of last jerk standing. Because if you're not a jerk and pass that Falcon-punch kill in the fist seconds because the other guy has no weapon, it'll come, hunt you down and kill you minutes later. There's no way of making friends after yours died looting while wearing horse glasses.

PUBG: BATTLEGROUNDS - A Battle Royale Classic with a Few Shadows 🎮🔫

⭐⭐⭐⭐ (4 Stars) - A thrilling battle royale experience with a caveat

PUBG: BATTLEGROUNDS has established itself as a pioneer in the battle royale genre, delivering an intense and competitive experience. However, it does come with a fair share of challenges that are worth noting.

🔒 Battling Cheaters - A Constant Struggle 🕵️‍♂️🚫
One of the persistent issues in PUBG is the presence of cheaters and hackers. The studio's efforts to address this problem by banning fake accounts and cheaters are commendable, but the battle against these disruptions continues.

👫 Best Played with Friends - Teamwork Triumphs 🤝🎮
PUBG truly shines when played with friends or as part of a team. Cooperation, communication, and strategizing with your squad add a layer of depth to the game that can be challenging to replicate in solo play.

🔫 Variety of Customizations - At a Price 💸🛍️
The game offers a wide array of customizations, from skins to weapon skins and more. These items can enhance your gaming experience and allow for personalization, but they come at a cost that might not be affordable for everyone.

PUBG: BATTLEGROUNDS continues to be a top contender in the battle royale genre, offering thrilling firefights and strategic gameplay. The ongoing battle against cheaters is a notable challenge, and while the studio's efforts are appreciated, it remains a point of concern. If you enjoy team-based play and can overlook the occasional hiccup, PUBG remains an exciting and competitive gaming experience. 🎮🤝🕵️‍♂️💸🚫🔫
