Game used to be fun, but PUBG refuses to do a proper job against cheaters. Set all of the optimization issues and terrible development choices aside.... and PUBG would still great without the cheating plague. Many casual players left over a year ago. If someone constantly dies to better players, and also constantly dies to same level players or worse players who are cheating, who else is there to beat? No one. Lose all the time = not fun. They're long gone. 

I took a 2 month hiatus end of December because I thought the cheating was getting out of control (and it was). I come back in early February feeling refreshed and hoping for a change and that PUBG had finally gotten its act together after years of f*** ups. Nope. Find 20 cheaters (probably more) in 40-50 games. I walk away again for a month. Come back one random night and encounter 3 cheaters in 5 games. 2 more months off brings us to tonight. First game maybe got unlucky. Second game two teams of cheaters fight it out at the end of the game. Players like UPC-BB and wwwww555555 is all you see now. wilma_digfit took multiple seasons to ban. Then you have SN1PER-HUNTEr, You_So_Sad, Seattle_ZuiShuai all banned but after the damage is already done. Over 1000+ names on a list I started keeping 2+ years ago. If there was ever a time that there are cheaters in EVERY SINGLE game you play, it's now, and back in the first half of 2018. Cheaters teaming up all the time means the anti-cheat isn't working. Let's be honest, it never worked, and it's slowly come to this. It may have worked too well at one point, cheaters were scared to buy another account because they may have gotten banned pretty fast. Then PUBG eased up to increase returning (cheater) customers, and the flood gates opened. Cheaters own the game because PUBG allows it. They ruin a game that could have been a Top 5 game of the DECADE and could have had a life span comparable to CS:GO and LoL. I wish I was rich so I could pay people to uninstall this game and never play it again. Not sure this game has ever been rated above "Mixed" on Steam over its entire lifespan, but it deserves much much worse. I wish I had 3 hands so I could give this game 3 thumbs down.

Edit: But hey, it's free now so I won't tell you not to try it.

I have played PUBG since its release and even though it has come a long way graphically, it isn't the best option for battle royal.  I am not an expert but between warzone, fortnite and apex; this game is unfortunately at the bottom of my hours spent playing.  Most maps are too big and lead to a looting/running simulator rather than a decent paced fps. There is no option for reviving teammates so most people when they die just leave meaning there is no reason to use mics and get to know someone or try to add them, they don't want to wait until you die to play again. The cheaters in this game like all games these days is just 50 50. I think this mainly is just from the game being free to play.  I don't know if pubg would attempt going back to purchasing the game but with the amount of account bans they show per week, this seems to be the last option. If you play a lot of matches then cheaters are not really that frequent from what Ive played. I will say that team killing players are way more frequent but as long as you keep reporting them then they will get banned eventually.  This game will easily become my number one game to play if they allow a res system and have the game be purchased.

PUBG: BATTLEGROUNDS is an adrenaline-pumping, heart-racing battle royale game that will keep you on the edge of your seat. With its intense gameplay, immersive graphics, and strategic depth, it is a must-play for all gaming enthusiasts.

First and foremost, PUBG offers a thrilling and competitive multiplayer experience. You are dropped onto a vast, realistic map alongside numerous other players, and the objective is simple: be the last person standing. The tension builds as the play area shrinks, forcing players into intense encounters and strategic decision-making. The rush of adrenaline when you outsmart your opponents and secure a hard-fought victory is unparalleled.

The game's graphics and attention to detail are truly impressive. From the realistic weapon models to the intricately designed environments, PUBG creates an immersive and believable battleground. The maps are diverse and meticulously crafted, ranging from dense forests to urban cityscapes, providing a variety of tactical options and ensuring that no two matches are the same.

Furthermore, PUBG offers a wide array of weapons, equipment, and vehicles to enhance your gameplay experience. Whether you prefer a stealthy approach or an all-out assault, there are options to suit every playstyle. The game also encourages strategic teamwork, allowing you to form squads with friends or join forces with other players to increase your chances of survival and domination.

The continuous updates and additions to PUBG ensure that the game remains fresh and exciting. The developers actively listen to the community and implement improvements, new features, and events, keeping players engaged and coming back for more. The commitment to maintaining a dynamic and evolving gaming experience is commendable.

Lastly, PUBG's esports scene has gained significant traction, with competitive tournaments and leagues attracting top players from around the world. This not only showcases the game's immense popularity but also provides an opportunity for players to test their skills against the best and potentially earn recognition.

In conclusion, PUBG: BATTLEGROUNDS is an electrifying battle royale game that offers an immersive experience, stunning graphics, and strategic gameplay. Its intense multiplayer battles, diverse maps, and constant updates make it a game worth investing time and support into. Join the battle, survive the chaos, and experience the thrill of emerging as the ultimate champion!

PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS (PUBG) adalah sebuah game battle-royale, 100 pemain, MMOFPS/TPS dunia terbuka di atas lahan seluas 8x8 km. Gim ini mendukung permainan solo, duo, dan regu (3-4 orang). Gameplaynya sangat mudah, Anda melompat dari pesawat, menjarah senjata, baju besi, dan peralatan dari bangunan, dan bertahan hidup dari pertumpahan darah PvP yang mendebarkan.

PUBG jelas bukan game battle-royale masif pertama yang ada di luar sana, namun PUBG berada di puncak genre-nya. Seperti yang mungkin sudah Anda ketahui, PUBG memiliki peluncuran yang sangat sukses, mengamankan tempat di game Top Seller Steam. Jika Anda mencari PvP battle-royale yang bagus, tidak perlu mencari lagi. Anda telah menemukannya.

The first and best Battlegrounds, despite all hose fancy unnecessary things...

PROS:
 Graphics are good
 Sound is good overall( i think the footsteps sounds are over-exaggerated).
 Variety of Weapons, accessories and weapons behavior.
 Erangel is Great.
 Vehicle physics are good .
 Team-play is key to success while playing in Squad mode.
 Great Learning curve. It's not a game for everyone, requires time to become any good.
 Best Battlegrounds so far...  Great reward feeling when getting a Chicken Dinner.


CONS
  Netcode is bad, really don't compare to "Source" games, it is too delayed and inconsistant, even affecting frame-rates at times(independent of the gpu you have).
  Enemy Draw Distance could be greater, 1,5 to 2 km would be great.
  Too many bold ultra-colored infantile clothes and items. This game had a "realistic" appeal to it. Those items make me fell I'm on a trance show or playing Fortnite, that's a shame.
  No more options to filter the map I wanna play in.
  Some items are too expensive to even wish(Average Brazilian wage is about 250 U$ dollars, some of you packs costs this much).
  Lots of Cheaters
  Too Many boots. They poop up anywhere randomly and see trough vegetation, what piss me off sometimes, spooting my position to real enemies..
  Not a Brazil inspired Map?? Come on...

HINTS to DEVS:
  Make a Brazilian beach or Favelas inspired 8x8 km map.
  Reduce footsteps sound radius distance, to 15~20 meters max.
  Make Higher Drawndistance for players and trees, 1km is too low to play with some sinper rifles.
  If can be done, improve netcode for smoothest performance(I know a game with 100 players tend to have those problems).
 A classical "servers list" search feature would not be a good idea??
 
Final Thoughts:
 *  Its one of those games that you either Love or Hate at first. Then you learn more to play and it will be a love-hating circle, till you get your firsts chicken dinners. It still piss me up sometimes, but when I try to play other alike its not as good as a experience.

TIPS For Beginners.
 ---> Go to training-map and test various different settings for you hardware mouse Sensitivity (DPI) with the % adjustments on Options Menu for every perspective, shoot various weapons(ARs, DMRs, Pistols) with different Scopes and Red-Dots till you find the best scenario for your play-style. It works wonders...


To Quick Boost your FPS maintaining good visuals( LowEnd to Medium GPUs):
Anti-Alias: Medium
PostFX - Very Low or Low
Shadows - Low or Medium
Texture - Medium or High
Effects - Medium or High
Vegetation - Medium
DrawDistance - Medium or High
Sharpen: Enable 
Vertical Sync - Off
Direct-X Level - 11 Enhanced

For good Definition Quality:
Window Mode: Full Screen
Render Scale: 100 to 120%

*original review below is from december 2017 holy shit im old*
With the release of the 1.0 update, the game has gotten significantly better.

- The game's optimization is much better, before 1.0, i would get around 50 - 80 on Erangel (The original map), but with this update i get around 80-100 on it, and on Miramar (The desert map), i get about 90-120

- The vaulting in my opinion is very smooth, but could use some fixes, it seems sometimes inconsistent on what you can vault on and can't. It also looked much cooler in the original reveal trailer of it than it does now, but i suspect thats for the sake of first person, because rolling in it would be very annoying, but thats just a visual thing. I do appreciate being able to have a key dedicated to vaulting, as it does seem a bit more consistent than the jump/vault key.

- The UI looks very nice, especially the new main menu which is a HUGE upgrade

- The new sounds for vehicles make it easier to tell which vehicle is which

- The new bomb zone sounds sound awesome

Polluted with cheaters!!

Developers don't care about fixing the game at all because 
why not add more skins with each and every update since that is more important than FPS drops and 
anti-cheat software.
It is very easy to notice in game that when you face a streamer, many of those use scripts and all
sorts of other hacks that are not being detected.

Tencent/Kraafton/PUBG  are selling these cheats themselves over many different affiliate websites.
If you do a little bit of network and IP tracking it all leads back to them.
PUBG partners are protected even when it's 100% clear that they are using cheats.

Each and every update is just about filling up the marketplace instead of QoL improvements.
They added a new gun in recent updates ( dragunov ) which is heavily unbalanced but when community says that we want QBU and QBZ in every map they don't do it.

I for instance play only ranked matches and want to use those two guns but i can't because if i want to use them i am forced to play normal matches which are even more cheater polluted since the game went F2P.

As someone who has wasted few thousands hours in game hoping something would chance i would not recommend this game to anyone in this state.
And don't let pro PUBG matches fool you, the every day matches we play are becoming almost impossible due to how many cheaters there are.

This is not a rant, it's the real current state of the game. 
I am positive that majority of you who read this comment would agree with me.

One way to start making a change is to do a heavy boycott and not buy any season passes or stuff in the marketplace unless they start making real changes to the game otherwise it will all go completely downhill where will be no return.

I myself like many of the skins and whatnot but i would never give them money for them until they start thinking about us PLAYERS and not their corporate benefit because when the game goes down they will still have a fat bank account and we the PLAYERS are the ones who will have wasted our hardly earned money.

Alright so 90% of my hours are from august 2017 - Feburary 2018. When i first got this game it was amazing, a whole new experience and for a long time i thought i never would get bored of this game. Back from August up until 1.0 the game was great. Although there was the problem with all the Q-qun accounts and chinese players that didnt really start until November. If Bluehole had focused on fixing the problems with the game like cheaters and the chinese community in general things may have turned out better; but instead Bluehole felt like sueing their competetor Epic games because for the reason "We are worried that fortnite may be trying to replicate the feeling that PUBG is known for" which is an absolute bull shit reason. Those are the reasons for the downfall and why i can no longer reccomend this game to people. I honestly like the gameplay of this more than fortnites but i refuse to play both at this time.

After spending over 1000 hours playing this game i will say even years into it's existence there is still a strong community enjoying the hours of game play that can be had.
Early days the game had lots of bugs and sometimes the game was hard to play from cheaters and bugs, now game play is much better more maps guns and cars have finished off this game nicely.
My biggest problem with this game is the now cluster of a UI and crafting for skins, it's clunky and just not good at all, at launch it was simple easy and almost good. The micro transactions aren't forced at you as bad as many other games but they're 100% there in full force and is honestly getting worse the longer the game goes on.
Cheaters have always been a massive issue and they're definitely still there but not majorly game breaking like it use to be but you will still encounter the odd cheater 
At the end of the day i love to play this game and there is still a strong community, there is no problems getting games even in OCE
